intro: Eritrichium armeriifolium, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and delicate blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. It is often found in meadows and open slopes at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
